intro: Eremogone qinghaiensis, commonly known as the Qinghai eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai region of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
